articles.title: Shapovalov advances at Paris Masters with win over Cerundolo
articles.description: PARIS — Canada's Denis Shapovalov advanced to the second round of the Paris Masters tennis tournament on Tuesday with a 6-7 (2), 6-3, 6-4 win over Argentina's Francisco Cerundolo. Shapovalov, from Richmond Hill, Ont.

articles.title: Analysis: Argentina's embattled left hopes for Lula bump. That looks a long shot
articles.description: Argentina's center-left President Alberto Fernandez, struggling in opinion polls ahead of elections next year, wasted no time in rushing to Brazil to congratulate political ally Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva after a dramatic win at the ballot box on Sunday.
articles.content: BUENOS AIRES, Nov 1 (Reuters) - Argentina's center-left President Alberto Fernandez, struggling in opinion polls ahead of elections next year, wasted no time in rushing to Brazil to congratulate political ally Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva after a dramat... [2607 chars]

articles.title: India's G20 presidency to focus on macroeconomic vulnerabilities, virtual assets: CEA
articles.description: The G20 is an intergovernmental forum of the world's major developed and developing economies including Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, China, France, Germany, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, the Republic of Korea, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Turkey, the UK, the US & EU.
articles.content:

articles.description: Like Pelé and David Beckham before him, Messi could have a far-reaching impact on American soccer

articles.title: Dramatic Photos of a Glacier that Stands in Defiance of Climate Change
articles.description: The Perito Moreno glacier in Los Glaciares National Park, Argentina is an anomaly among global glaciers: it refuses to recede.
articles.content:
Photographer Blake Burton has created a photo essay that focuses on the Perito Moreno glacier in Los Glaciares National Park, Argentina which is an anomaly among global glaciers: it refuses to recede.
